timeline.bodyText:
Now that we have Kotlin in the repository, I think it would be much better to have this implemented fully in Kotlin.
That means, maybe we should merge it with RxJavaExtensions below and have everything as top-level functions.
Let me know what you think.
timeline.author: tasomaniac

replies.bodyText: Totally agree! I would love to follow up with another PR doing this - I think adding that to this PR would be a little bit out of scope since it would be done for both Rx2 and Rx3 support.
replies.author: Jawnnypoo

replies.bodyText:
That means, maybe we should merge it with RxJavaExtensions below and have everything as top-level functions.

Does that mean RxJava3 support will not be usable for Java callers ?
replies.author: martinbonnin

replies.bodyText: Ah no, the changes could be made in a way that makes it fully compatible and callable from Java.
replies.author: Jawnnypoo

replies.bodyText: Yep, that can be done via JvmStatic and JvmName annotations
replies.author: tasomaniac

replies.bodyText: @tasomaniac Would you prefer me to change this PR to include those changes as well? Or can I do a follow up PR?
replies.author: Jawnnypoo

replies.bodyText: If you want to do a follow-up that would be awesome. Let's merge this then.
replies.author: tasomaniac
